The term "full shot" might be inaccurate if the arcing camera moves closer, potentially transitioning into a medium shot by the end. Furthermore, the caption undersells the visual impact of the camera's arc on the stationary subjects. Stating they "remain mostly stationary" is factually correct for the subjects themselves, but it fails to describe the significant visual effect of them being repositioned within the frame from the viewer's perspective. For instance, the man who starts on the left would appear to slide across the background to the right side of the frame as the camera orbits. A more accurate description would detail how the camera's counterclockwise arc causes the background elements and the stationary men to shift from left to right within the frame, while the cyclist is kept as the central, pivotal point of the motion. The initial depth could also be clearer, specifying if one man is in the foreground, the cyclist in the middle ground, and the third man further back against the wall, establishing a clearer sense of three-dimensional space from the start.
